commitResults.messageTitle: Rename chatbot from Duke to Kraken
Implement Level 1 Echo functionality
Add task storage and list functionality
Add mark/unmark functionality with Task class
Level 4: Add Todo, Deadline, and Event task types
Add error handling for invalid inputs with KrakenException
Add delete command and refactor to ArrayList
Storage: Add auto-save and load functionality
commitResults.messageBody:
- Add Storage class with load/save methods using data/kraken.txt
- Load tasks from disk on startup in Kraken.main
- Auto-save after each mutation (add/mark/unmark/delete)
- Add getters to Task classes for serialization
- Update test scripts to clean data file before tests
- Add **/data/kraken.txt to .gitignore (wildcard covering data/kraken.txt and text-ui-test/data/kraken.txt)

commitResults.messageTitle: refactor: Use List interface instead of ArrayList
refactor: Use Java 16+ toList() instead of Collectors
Merge branch 'branch-Level-7'
Level 8: Add date/time support with LocalDateTime
commitResults.messageBody: - Storage uses ISO local date-time for persistence

commitResults.messageTitle: DateTimeUtil: Restrict user input to human formats
commitResults.messageBody:
Split date/time parsing into user-facing and storage methods:
- parseUserDateTime/parseUserDate: Accept only human-readable formats
  (yyyy-MM-dd, d/M/yyyy, optionally with HHmm). Reject ISO date-time
  with 'T' (e.g., 2019-12-02T18:00) in user commands.
- parseStorageDateTime: Parse ISO local date-time for persistence.

Refactor multi-format parsing to use loops over formatter arrays
instead of repeated try/catch blocks for better readability.

Update Kraken handlers to use parseUserDateTime/parseUserDate.
Update Storage to use parseStorageDateTime for loading saved tasks.

Storage continues to persist dates in ISO format (2019-12-02T18:00)
for stability and unambiguous parsing.

commitResults.messageTitle: Merge branch 'branch-Level-8'
Refactor OOP: Extract Ui, TaskList, Parser, and Command classes
commitResults.messageBody:
- Extract Ui class for all user interactions (input/output)
- Extract TaskList class to encapsulate task operations
- Extract Parser class to parse user commands
- Implement Command hierarchy (ExitCommand, ListCommand, TodoCommand, DeadlineCommand, EventCommand, OnCommand, MarkCommand, UnmarkCommand, DeleteCommand)
- Refactor Kraken to use constructor + run() method pattern
- Preserve exact CLI output format for text-ui-test compatibility

commitResults.messageTitle: Merge branch 'A-MoreOOP'
refactor: Organize classes into Java packages
commitResults.messageBody:
Move all classes from default package into kraken.* packages:
- kraken: main entry point
- kraken.command: command classes
- kraken.parser: input parser
- kraken.task: task model classes
- kraken.ui: user interface
- kraken.storage: file persistence
- kraken.util: date/time utilities
- kraken.exception: custom exceptions

Update test scripts to compile recursively and use fully qualified class name (kraken.Kraken) instead of default package class

commitResults.messageTitle: Merge branch 'A-Packages'
Merge remote-tracking branch 'origin/add-gradle-support'
build.gradle: Update main class and jar name
test: Add JUnit tests for Parser and DateTimeUtil
commitResults.messageBody:
Add comprehensive JUnit 5 tests to verify the behavior of two
non-trivial methods from different classes:

- ParserTest: Tests Parser.parse() method covering:
  * Invalid input handling (null, blank, unknown commands)
  * Command-specific validation (todo, deadline, event, mark/unmark/delete)
  * Successful command execution verifying TaskList state changes
  * Uses no-op Ui and Storage stubs to isolate parsing logic

- DateTimeUtilTest: Tests DateTimeUtil.parseUserDateTime() method covering:
  * Supported date/time formats (ISO and slash formats)
  * Date-only vs date-time parsing
  * Input trimming and validation
  * Rejection of invalid dates/times and unsupported formats

./gradlew test
All tests pass successfully with the existing JUnit 5 setup in build.gradle

commitResults.messageTitle: docs: Add comprehensive JavaDoc coverage to codebase
commitResults.messageBody: {@inheritDoc} is a JavaDoc tag that copies documentation from a parent class or interface. When overriding a method, use it to reuse the parentâ€™s docs and optionally add more.

commitResults.messageTitle: Merge branch 'A-JavaDoc'
Configure code style settings with settings.json
commitResults.messageBody:
- Add VS Code workspace settings for coding standard compliance
- Set tab size to 4 spaces with insertSpaces enabled
- Disable detectIndentation to enforce consistent formatting
- Enable auto-trim whitespace and final newline insertion
- Remove extra blank lines at end of all Java files
- Enable format on save and format on paste

commitResults.messageTitle: Merge branch 'A-CodingStandard'
Add find command to search tasks by keyword
commitResults.messageBody:
Implement Level 9 find functionality that allows users to search for tasks by keyword. The search is case-insensitive and matches tasks whose description contains the keyword as a substring.

- Add FindCommand class to handle search logic
- Update Parser to recognize and validate find command
- Add UI methods for displaying search results
- Include unit tests and text-ui-test coverage

Add Checkstyle configuration

Run checkstyle and fix issues
